page.title: 07Codsall Police Station
page.content: A group of children from Codsall Middle School visited the Station and spoke to WPC.Turner.This is what they found out. The Station is situated centrally on W'ton Rd. and has been in service for 17 years. It is not manned full time now but was originally built as a police house with 3 upstairs rooms and 4 downstairs. There are 37 officers on the Codsall force, including 3 police women. 35 of them live in Codsall. The tallest officer is 6'5" while the longest serving member has been on the force for 22 years and has received a Good Conduct Award. The Station has 4 Patrol Cars, 1 Supervision Car and 1 CID. Car. It is a busy Station but does not receive emergency calls, these are directed to Stafford. They have a lot of false alarms from children about bogus fires and accidents. The most common crime is indecent exposure.
